TopicTitle: Top Gun AI - The Official Tournament Thread

Articles.Content:
Hummingbird Mk 2a v2

[http://www./download/lmcpnqs3w6cxcbj/F-9+Hummingbird+2a+v2.craft](http://www./download/lmcpnqs3w6cxcbj/F-9+Hummingbird+2a+v2.craft)

Point count: 69

![MKEJcKD.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/MKEJcKD.jpg)

> 
> Would this guy qualify?
> [http://i.imgur.com/zMBydxF.png](http://i.imgur.com/zMBydxF.png)
> 
> If I counted right, it hits 59 points.
> 
> It's the first fighter I've built to perform effectively and I want to know how he does against something dedicated. Comes with an inline radome, 2 chaff dispensers and 3 flares for utility, and the armament should be obvious, except for 1 hidden Vulcan under the Nacelle serving as a rear gunner.

Yeah, that works! Good luck, 8.5/10 originality for a similar armament and body but different everything else.
[Well, here he is if you want him.](http://www./download/2iwn43v1clv5n4o/Sky+Arrow+Offensive.craft)

Tournament overview: We are going to allow 8 planes. The high demand was surprising for this tournament, so I will have 4 matches to record on our first day. It may take 2 weekends.

Entrants:

> ![F0KmOIP.png](http://i.imgur.com/F0KmOIP.png)

As for originality point ratings, here you go:

Snowflake:10

AAIF-3:9

FA-20:8.75

Hummingbird 2aV2:8.5

Devil:8

Sky Arrow Offensive:9

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-19T23:31:59Z" title="10/19/2015 11:31  PM" data-short="8 yr">October 19, 2015</time> by Alphasus**
The tournament will start in 2 days. Everyone may now submit 1 extra plane of their own design, and I will choose what gets in via originality points.
I was planning on making an armored plane but I don't have my computer. Next time maybe

***Winners for the first round:*** 

Snowflake

F-9 Hummingbird 2aV2

FA-20 Thunderstrike

***Losers for the first round:***

Sky Arrow Offensive

Devil

AAIF-3

Good luck in the next round!

Videos here:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/videoseries?list=PLqlvfyioOb1I6t0MxYtHfuQq6smcNGtGf" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

(Side note: If anyone feels that a result was unfair or undeserved, please tell me on the weekend of the round. I will be sure to investigate and will do my best to find the solution.)

Badges here:[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/130238-Top-Gun-AI-The-Official-Tournament-Thread/page53](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/130238-Top-Gun-AI-The-Official-Tournament-Thread/page53)

Badge recipients include:Evstaman(Sergeant),Alphasus(Sergeant)gag09(Sergeant)

All participants will receive a rookie badge.

gag09 is on his way to a "Hotshot" badge. Only 2 more kills!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-24T19:42:55Z" title="10/24/2015 07:42  PM" data-short="8 yr">October 24, 2015</time> by Alphasus**

gag09, "Hotshot" and "Tightwad" are yours.

***Winners for the second round:***

FA-20 Thunderstrike

***Losers for the second round:***

Devil

***Ties:***

F-9 Hummingbird 2AV2 vs Snowflake

Devil vs FA-20 Thunderstrike(wrong version of Thunderstrike, had no countermeasures).Ran test, FA-20 won 4 of 5 times with countermeasures.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-25T21:46:26Z" title="10/25/2015 09:46  PM" data-short="8 yr">October 25, 2015</time> by Alphasus**
I think you used the wrong version of my devil too, I sent you the new one and I remember I changed the angle of the wings, maybe try look at the private message. If it's the same, then ignore it
It was the same, but I will fix it for your next match.
Ok then, I think I sent the wrong file then, my bad
They said going all guns was a bad idea I showed them. ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)
Just use 40 pts for counter measures and the rest for GAU - 8s and ammo box.
That's what I did except I used 8 chain guns.

Actually which kind of gun is the best, GAU-8 have the highest firing rate( I think) but you cannot put as much of it as other guns like vulcans. So.. which is better?

Btw, this thread is nearing 100 pages.

I like the chainguns they seem to be better at long range.
